reviews.review_msg: Contrary to others, I enjoyed Rejean ! He was really engaging and I always looked forward to his lectures. I will say that there was a lot of course material. As someone who speaks French well, I did not have a problem other than memorizing certain terms. I could tell that everyone else had trouble keeping up. The average on assignments was 73 %.

I found him arrogant. He also encourages you to come get help during office hours however, I always walked out without out any answers to my questions. He is also disorganized and uses the over head projectorand it is nearly impossible to read anything if your not sitting in the front row.

One of the worst French profs in my opinion. He is unorganized and if you can read the textbook there's no sense in you going to class.  I found him arrogant and not very personable.  However, he is a fair marker.
He is an excellent prof, though this course was very challenging for me. But I learned a lot about grammar. Good attitude and very helpful, I will take more courses with him.

The course seems relatively straightforward, until this professor utilisizes complicated ways to explain simple grammar rules. Assignments, exams, and presentations were made much more difficult-leaving it near impossible for students to excel in the course. Quelle dommage!

Awesome professor: extreemely helpful, made an otherwise boring subject (grammar) an intriguing one. Learned a perspective I never have from traditional courses.  Tries to make students think, very original in his presentations, encourages  discussions. Expects a lot from students. Some may find him difficult:  I found him stimulating.
this guy would make learning how to tie your shoelaces confusing! nice guy but can't convey anything clearly. i will not take a class with him again
